Act Definition.0: An Act to amend the law respecting the age of majority.
Act Definition.1: Preamble. — Whereas, in the case of persons domiciled in 2[India] it is expedient 3[to specify the age of majority];

paragraphs.0: This Act may be called the 4*** Majority Act, 1875.
paragraphs.1: Local extent. — 5[It extends to the whole of India 6[except the State of Jammu and Kashmir]].
paragraphs.2: Commencement and operation. —and it shall come into force and have effect only on the expiration of three months from the passing thereof.

contains.0: (a) the capacity of any persons to act in the following matters (namely), —marriage, dower, divorce and adoption;
contains.1: (b) the religion or religious rites and usages of any class of 7[citizens of India]; or
contains.2: (c) the capacity of any person who before this Act comes into force has attained majority under the law applicable to him.

Section 3..heading: Age of majority of persons domiciled in India.

paragraphs.0: (1) Every person domiciled in India shall attain the age of majority on his completing the age of eighteen years and not before.

1.text: (2) In computing the age of any person, the day on which he was born is to be included as a whole day and he shall be deemed to have attained majority at the beginning of the eighteenth anniversary of that day.]

paragraphs.2: (a) Z is born in 2[India] on the first day of January, 1850, and has 9[an Indian domicile]. A guardian of his person is appointed by a Court of Justice. Z attains majority at the first moment of the first day of January, 1871.
paragraphs.3: (b) Z is born in 2[lndia] on the twenty-ninth day of February 1852, and has 10[an Indian domicile]. A guardian of his property is appointed by a Court of Justice. Z attains majority at the first moment of the twenty- eighth day of February, 1873.
paragraphs.4: (c) Z is born on the first day of January, 1850. He acquires a domicile in 2[India]. No guardian is appointed of his person or property of any Court of Justice, nor is he under the jurisdiction of any Court of Wards. Z attains majority at the first moment of the day of January, 1868.
